trans-unit.source: Provides a specialized <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource"></xref> that is optimized for loading images using Extensible Application Markup Language (XAML).

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> primarily exists to support [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_xaml](~/includes/tlasharptla-xaml-md.md)] syntax and introduces additional properties for bitmap loading that are not defined by <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.
Property changes can only occur during object initialization.

Call <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.BeginInit%2A> to signal that initialization has begun and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.EndInit%2A> to signal that initialization has completed.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.

<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> objects created using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.%23ctor%2A> constructor are automatically initialized and property changes are ignored.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> class.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> implements the <xref:System.ComponentModel.ISupportInitialize> interface to optimize initialization on multiple properties.

To initialize a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> created using this constructor, you must perform property initialization between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.EndInit%2A> calls.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> class by using the supplied <xref href="System.Uri"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> to use as the source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The uriSource parameter is `null`.
The file specified by the uriSource parameter is not found.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> class with an image whose source is a <xref href="System.Uri"></xref>, and is cached according to the provided <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref>.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> objects created using this constructor are automatically initialized.
After initialization, property changes are ignored.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.%23ctor%28System.Uri%2CSystem.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy%29> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> to use as the source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref> that specifies the caching requirements for images that are obtained using HTTP.
The uriSource parameter is `null`.
The file specified by the uriSource parameter is not found.
Gets or sets a value that represents the base <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> of the current <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> context.
The base <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> of the current context.
Signals the start of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> initialization.
Property initialization must be done between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.EndInit%2A> calls.
Once the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> is currently being initialized.
<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.BeginInit"></xref> has already been called.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> has already been initialized.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref> to use for this instance of <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.

Set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.CacheOption%2A> to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption?displayProperty=fullName> if you wish to close a stream used to create the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage>.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption.OnDemand> cache option retains access to the stream until the image is needed, and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption"></xref> being used for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption.Default"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.CacheOption"></xref> dependency property.
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>, making deep copies of this object's values.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.Clone%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
When copying dependency properties, this method copies resource references and data bindings (they might no longer resolve) but not animations or their current values.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true.`
Creates a modifiable clone of this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> object, making deep copies of this object's current values.
Resource references, data bindings, and animations are not copied, but their current values are.
This method is used to produce modifiable copies of frozen <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> objects (or any <xref:System.Windows.Freezable> object).
For convenience, this method shadows the inherited version.
For more information, see <xref:System.Windows.Freezable.CloneCurrentValue%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
A modifiable clone of the current object.
The cloned object's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `false` even if the source's <xref href="System.Windows.Freezable.IsFrozen"></xref> property is `true`.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> for a <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions"></xref> used for this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions.None"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.CreateOptions"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the height, in pixels, that the image is decoded to.
If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelWidth%2A> is also set, the aspect ratio of the bitmap is ignored.
If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelWidth%2A> is not set, the aspect ratio remains the same.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpeg](~/includes/tlasharptla-jpeg-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_png](~/includes/tlasharptla-png-md.md)] codecs natively decode the image to the specified size; other codecs decode the image at its original size and scale the image to the desired size.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The height, in pixels, that the image is decoded to.
The default value is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelHeight"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the width, in pixels, that the image is decoded to.
If<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelHeight%2A> is also set, the aspect ratio of the bitmap is ignored.
If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelHeight%2A> is not set, the aspect ratio remains the same.

The [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_jpeg](~/includes/tlasharptla-jpeg-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_png](~/includes/tlasharptla-png-md.md)] codecs natively decode the image to the specified size; other codecs decode the image at its original size and scale the image to the desired size.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The width, in pixels, that the image is decoded to.
The default value is 0.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelWidth"></xref> dependency property.
Signals the end of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> initialization.
Property initialization must be done between <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.BeginInit%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.EndInit%2A> calls.
Once the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> has been initialized, property changes are ignored.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriSource"></xref> or <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.StreamSource"></xref> properties are `null`.
-or-
The <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.EndInit"></xref> method is called without first calling <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.BeginInit"></xref>.
Gets a value that indicates whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> is currently downloading content.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> is downloading content; otherwise, `false`.
Not supported.

<xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> does not support the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.Metadata"></xref> property and will throw a <xref href="System.NotSupportedException"></xref>.
Not supported.
An attempt to read the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.Metadata"></xref> occurs.
Gets or sets the angle that this <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref> is rotated to.
Rotation is performed after scaling.

This means that an image that has a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.Rotation%2A> of <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate90>, a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelWidth%2A> of 10, and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.DecodePixelHeight%2A> of 5 will result in an image that has a width of 5 and a height of 10.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The rotation that is used for the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.Rotation.Rotate0"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.Rotation"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the rectangle that is used as the source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The rectangle that is used as the source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Int32Rect.Empty"></xref>.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.SourceRect"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets the stream source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.

If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.StreamSource%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriSource%2A> are both set, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.StreamSource%2A> value is ignored.

Set the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.CacheOption%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption?displayProperty=fullName> if you wish to close the stream after the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage> is created.
The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption.OnDemand> cache option retains access to the stream until the bitmap is needed, and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The stream source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.StreamSource"></xref> dependency property.
Gets or sets a value that represents the caching policy for images that come from an HTTP source.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriCachePolicy%2A> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
The base <xref href="System.Net.Cache.RequestCachePolicy"></xref> of the current context.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriCachePolicy"></xref> dependency property.
<xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriCachePolicyProperty> is introduced in the .NET Framework version 3.5.
For more information, see [Versions and Dependencies](~/docs/framework/migration-guide/versions-and-dependencies.md).
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.

If <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.StreamSource%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriSource%2A> are both set, the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.StreamSource%2A> value is ignored.
Dependency Property Information
Identifier field
Metadata properties set to `true`
None
The <xref href="System.Uri"></xref> source of the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage"></xref>.
The default is `null`.
Identifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapImage.UriSource"></xref> dependency property.
